text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen now 
a few of you may remember that last year when

I went back to Thailand I met up with mark Wiens 
from migration ology and one of the things that we

had was crispy fried catfish with a green mango 
salad and it was delicious it's something that

I've always loved and I'm so excited that I can 
finally make it for you guys today because green

mango something we became available at my local 
grocer so this dish in Thai is called Yum pla duk

foo yum is a type of Thai salad pla duk is 
catfish and foo means fluffy so it's a very

interesting cooking technique so if you haven't 
had this before stick around it's very cool let's

get started now as the name suggests this dish 
typically uses catfish and not just any catfish

Thai catfish that has been slowly grilled on a 
charcoal grill and those are widely available in

Thailand so it's you know something easy to find 
I can't find them here however as you'll see it

really doesn't matter what kind of fish you use 
so I go with the least expensive kind basically so

I've got here some tilapia so some tilapia fillet 
that I get frozen but I want to give them a little

flavor so I'm going to add some soy sauce you can 
just salt them it really doesn't matter at this

point and now I'm going to cook this off just use 
the easiest way to cook it so for me I'm going to

steam them green mangoes so when they sell mangoes 
at the store these are like the ones nobody wants

except me so it's great I don't have to fight 
over these with anyone so green mangoes are just

under ripe mangoes okay they're not a special 
kind of green variety or anything and you can

use other varieties of mango as long as they are 
sour and that's important to note because not all

varieties of mango are sour when they are green 
okay and the sourness is really what we want see

even this one is has gone a little riper than I'd 
like too because it's quite yellow now but it'll

still be very sour so I'm going to make little 
Julianne's and I'm going to use the same trick

same technique as when I julienne my green papaya 
we just a chopped up chop and you can hear that

the flesh is quite firm and then you just slice 
off nice thin slices of mango just like that right

there we go all right so here's my shredded 
mango I want to point out though that this

is softer and yellower than it should be if you 
can get your sperm er even better okay it's just

I got these four days ago and we weren't filming 
til today so they've had time to ripen a little

bit in the fridge if you get a mango and you're 
not ready to use it to prevent it from getting

sweet put them in the fridge okay and then they 
won't sweeten and ripen as fast they might turn

yellow like this but the sweetness won't come 
out as quickly all right so the dressing that

we are making is just a standard yumm dressing 
I'm going to start out with some fresh chilies

going into my little wooden mortar here and I'm 
just going to grind the chilies up and now I'm

going to add some palm sugar it might look like a 
lot but we're making quite a bit of sauce and also

you want to contrast the sourness if the dressing 
isn't sweet then this will be way too sour so I'm

going to just mash it after it's turned into like 
a muddy paste kind of like this then you're ready

to go in with the liquid seasoning which is of 
course fish sauce cannot have a yum without fish

sauce so keep swirling that until the sugar seems 
like it's mostly dissolved so now we've got sweet

spicy salty and of course sour so I'm going 
to add some more lime juice okay see if I can

do this without spilling a mmm well that looks 
good so now I'm going to add some shallots as

the shallots sit the pungent is going to slowly 
leach into the dressing and sort of bring all

the flavors together right so you want to do this 
a little bit in advance I think this is optional

but I chopped up some dry shrimp I added in it 
adds a little nice chewy umami flavor I'm going

to add the mango in as much as I can fit while 
sort of keeping everything submerged you may just

sort of have to save the rest for refills okay 
so that looks good oh my god I'm like so and the

smell of it is so so good so here's the fish it's 
been cooked and by the way I did say you can cook

this however you want but I would avoid any method 
that creates hard crispy surface like a you know

deep fryer pan fry where you get that thick crust 
because those thick bits don't tend to fluff up

as well later when we go to fluff it so steaming 
I think is the fastest and easiest way to do it

that's why I do it okay so I'm going to transfer 
this now into a bowl lined with muslin hang with

me hang with me I know this is looking a little 
strange right now squeeze all the liquid out of

this fish because we're going to deep-fry this 
fish and all that liquid will make it will make

the fish not fluff as well and also it could be 
really dangerous or so much liquid in that right

now if we deep-fry it your oil will just kind of 
go crazy right so I just squeeze and just look

how much liquid comes out of there yes you are 
literally juicing your fish here see this is why I

said go with the cheapest on if you're in Thailand 
you want to use the grilled catfish you don't need

to do this because the catfish is slowly grilled 
on charcoal and the meat is so dry by the time

it's done that you won't have this problem 
okay so now as you can see you've got fluffy

fish we're gonna make it even fluffier don't put 
this in your laundry hamper for three days that

would be really gross so now we need to pound it 
just to get it all really really fluffy and it'll

happen really quickly so you won't it won't take 
long and by the way in Thailand some people will

bulk this up with some panko breadcrumbs and for 
two reasons one it's cheaper right because this

is all protein and the other reason is the panko 
helps absorb some of that moisture but because

we squeeze all that liquid out of it and then 
we don't need to do that then we can get all

protein let's talk safety okay because it could 
potentially be dangerous now we're going to deep

fry the fish fluff in this oil here what's going 
to happen is the oil is going to go you want this

very hot so 400 degrees ish so it's important 
that you don't fill the oil apps too far so I

would not even go halfway up the pot because when 
oyel fluff stop it's going to overflow and then it

will catch fire and I know this because I know 
someone that this happened to so here we go and

you can put in more than you think so I probably 
this will make to this size so of course the size

will depend on the circumference of your pot right 
actually that didn't feel quite hot enough once it

starts to turn kind of golden I'm going to kind of 
fold it in half so that because that's the shape I

want it to be at the end so some people fold it 
into different shapes or they just leave it as

a circle that's it look at that and magically 
they just kind of hang together okay nice I'm

going to go in with my second batch although I'm 
going to let the oil heat up a little bit more

and you want to sprinkle it in right you 
don't want to dump it in the middle and

then as you can see they want to sort of 
stick to the side I go in and I push it

in that second round there is sort of 
how hot it should be that first round

there was a little weak so have a 
you know fire extinguisher on him

all right so just want to point out this first 
one the oil wasn't quite hot I mean it works

but as you can see it's not as fluffy as this one 
and it took a bit longer I mean they're both fine

but I'm just pointing out the difference how 
fascinating huh all right so when you weren't

looking I stirred in a little fresh cilantro 
into the mango salad and by the way you want

to make the mango salad before you fry the 
fish because you want to serve the fish hot

and also as the mango sits it releases some of 
its juices into the dressing so this will get

better as it sits some people serve the mango 
separately but I think this is so much better

you get a much more cohesive flavor okay now ever 
so gently yay oh so cute some peanuts so I'm just

gonna actually scatter them all around because 
I want a lot of peanuts okay nice get some rice

look so perfect oh yes take some of the mango 
salad and then make sure you get some peanuts

in there or cashews a lot of people do cashews 
if you're allergic to peanuts and so hungry I

can't think of another dish that I prefer oh that 
catfish is so crunchy but because it's all protein

they're sort of there's a really satisfying 
flavor to it with tartness and freshness of

the mango and that slight sweetness on the sauce 
it do it's it's so good so please please please

if you can find mango that is sour give it a go 
I know it's a little bit intimidating to try to

fry that fish I know I was intimidated to fry it 
the first time but it really isn't that hard if

you are careful with it and you will be so glad 
that you did so the recipe as always will be on

hot side kitchen comm when you make it send me 
a photo on Facebook Twitter and Instagram and I

next time for your next submission time meal so 
this is why I said go with the cheapest one here's

some twenty dollar pound halibut yes doesn't it 
look beautiful now let's let's lately destroy it
